column1: Esophageal atresia is a disorder of the digestive system in which the esophagus does not develop properly.
The esophagus is the tube that normally carries food from the mouth to the stomach.
Esophageal atresia (EA) is a congenital defect.
In addition, infants with EA/TEF often have tracheomalacia.
Some babies with EA/TEF have other defects as well, most commonly heart defects.
